thread.title: Seacoast Roundup: Balanced scoring lifts Exeter boys soccer to win
thread.title_full: Seacoast Roundup: Balanced scoring lifts Exeter boys soccer to win

author: Staff Reports sports@seacoastonline.com
title: Seacoast Roundup: Balanced scoring lifts Exeter boys soccer to win
text: Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 11:14 PM By Staff Reports Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 11:14 PM » Social News KEENE — Exeter High School boys soccer coach Jim Tufts knows the bus ride to Keene is a long one. But the road back is a lot nicer when you come home with a win. The Blue Hawks scored three goals in each half and cruised to a 6-0 win on Friday in a Division I game. Exeter, with its second straight win, is now 9-3 on the season. Keene is 1-11. Exeter got a balanced scoring attack with six scorers, including Jack Carr, Evan Royer, Ale Torres dePalma, Josh Rubin, Lee Veader and Quinn Mantegari. Caden Blazek and Jake Spitz each played a half in the Exeter goal, each making a save. BOYS SOCCER Trinity 3 Portsmouth 0 MANCHESTER — The Clippers saw their two-game win streak come to an end with this Division II loss. Portsmouth is now 3-8 on the season, while Trinity won for the fourth time in five games and improved to 8-3-1. GIRLS SOCCER Berwick Academy 3 Kents Hill 0 READFIELD, Maine — Siobhan McDermott, Caroline Starr and Abby Moore each scored a goal for Berwick Academy (7-0-3) in this Eastern Independent League game.
